data.title: There is currently no explicit conversion from IntVector3 to Vector3
data.body: Some constructor that would cast the float componts of the Vector3 to integers for the IntVector3 would be nice.

data.title: Not getting user preference option in file menu
data.body: Not getting user preference option in file menu. Please correct me on this ?

data.title: C++11 upgrade: typedef to using, 0 to nullptr, added override
data.body:
Here is C++11 upgrade of Urho core.
Regardless of code standard discussion, I updated three items that are unquestionably better than C++98 counterparts.
~~Samples and Tools will be upgraded tomorrow.~~

1st and 3rd commit are made by Visual Assist/Code Refactoring/Quick Fix.
2nd is manual.
4th is regex replace + manual check.

data.title: Skyplane technique fixed.
data.body:
Now it is rendering a fullscreeen backgroud image as (i guess) it was intended.

It looks like "skyplane" previously wasn't implemented the same way as other "sky*" techniques which seemed as a mistake. This one could be useful for a background images like camera feed, etc.

data.title: Add attribute metadata.
data.body:
It's probably better to merge this part separately.
Resolves #1766.

data.title: Fix too strict assert in kNet.
data.body:
I don't know if I should make pull request to Urho or kNet, so I'll first try this place :)

If you call `kNet::MessageConnection::sendMessage()` with zero length data, one of the assertions will fail. The reason for this is that `kNet::NetworkMessage::Resize()` does not allocate memory for `data` if length is zero, which is perfectly logical. However the assertion in `kNet::MessageConnection::sendMessage()` does not take this into account. This PR fixes the assertion, so it does not care about NULL if length is also zero.

data.title: Make Variant able to store any type.
data.body:
1. Varaint is able to store any custom type
2. Types are stored without memory allocation if `sizeof(Type) <= sizeof(void*)*2`
3. It is guaranteed that there is no internal allocations if assign the same type again (either directly or inside another Variant)
4. It is guaranteed that assignment operator is called in this case
5. ~~Custom types cannot be compared to either custom type or zero~~
6. Custom types cannot serialized
7. Custom types can be converted to string, compared to zero or each other if traits are specialized

The main purpose was to type-safely store pointers in the Variant.

data.title: Compiling Urho3D with Clang
data.body:
Hello. I'm trying to compile Urho3D using Clang 4.0.1 on Windows x64 (built myself, not the binary version available on the website), and I'll try to document the issues I came across.

Of course, there's plenty of warnings. Should I make a new issue for those? I'll omit them as of now. I'll include them later.

I built with `URHO3D_NETWORK` and `URHO3D_URHO2D` disabled, as well as `URHO3D_SAMPLES`, and with `URHO3D_OPENGL` plus `URHO3D_C++11`. All done on the latest commit on master (usually keep updated). If anyone wants options changed though please ask and I'll try a build if possible.

* `error: unrecognized command line option "-fno-keep-inline-dllexport"`
Compiling fails with this error. Fixed by removing the occurrences near line 683:
```cmake
elseif (MINGW)
        # MinGW-specific setup
        # Removed -fno-keep-inline-dllexport from both
        set (CMAKE_C_FLAGS "${CMAKE_C_FLAGS} -static -static-libgcc")
        set (CMAKE_CXX_FLAGS "${CMAKE_CXX_FLAGS} -static -static-libgcc -static-libstdc++")
```

* SSE disabled by default. Works fine when enabled manually.
```
CMake Warning at CMake/Modules/UrhoCommon.cmake:172 (message):
  Disabling SSE by default due to MinGW version.  It is recommended to
  upgrade to MinGW with GCC >= 4.9.1.  You can also try to re-enable SSE with
  CMake option -DURHO3D_SSE=1, but this may result in compile errors.
Call Stack (most recent call first):
  CMakeLists.txt:45 (include)
```

data.title: Disregard Menu accelerator keys when a LineEdit is focused
data.body:
Typing keys that are an accelerator key would fire up Menu actions. In the case of issue #2100, U or Ctrl-U would be one way to cause the Editor quick action window to be closed, due to logic code in the Editor that causes each menu selection to close it.

Not sure if this is wanted in each case, but would seem to make sense, particularly if there are accelerators bound without qualifier.

data.title: [Editor] "Parent to last" keybinding closes quick action menu
data.body:
Was wondering if it would be possible to remap the binding. Currently closes the quick action menu. Prevents searching for commands like "Run script..."

https://github.com/urho3d/Urho3D/blob/a523e604dc7197efce7c7444d8bf6aa938502d65/bin/Data/Scripts/Editor/EditorUI.as#L420

data.title: 2D Relative Particles
data.body:
The [ParticleEffect](https://urho3d.github.io/documentation/HEAD/class_urho3_d_1_1_particle_effect.html) and [ParticleEmitter](https://urho3d.github.io/documentation/HEAD/class_urho3_d_1_1_particle_emitter.html) classes both have the function **SetRelative(true|false)** which allows the particles to update their behaviour relative to their node as opposed to the scene node. 

The 2D counterparts [ParticleEffect2D](https://urho3d.github.io/documentation/HEAD/class_urho3_d_1_1_particle_effect2_d.html) and [ParticleEmitter2D](https://urho3d.github.io/documentation/HEAD/class_urho3_d_1_1_particle_emitter2_d.html) do not yield any implementation of this.

data.title: Added operator overloads for multiplying IntVectors
data.body: This PR allows for `IntVector2` and `IntVector3` to also be multiplied by vectors of the same type instead of only scalars. With `Vector2` and `Vector3` this was already possible.

data.title: Refactor Variant (part #1)
data.body: I removed those nasty reinterpret casts from Variant. Also added int64 to float/double casts in getters and fixed cast in `op == (ULL)`

data.title: Inherit transform mode
data.body:
In some situations child node should inherit parent position but ingnore scaling of parent node.

p.s. I could not test this for LUA. Bite operations added in LUA 5.3 but urho used lua 5.1,
so
```
childNode.inheritMode = INHERIT_ROTATION | INHERIT_POSITION
```
just not works

data.title: During peak hour iOS and tvOS CI packaging build may still be running out of time
data.body: This is despite the pre-cache build stage is already in place.

data.title: Created Selectable UI element
data.body:
I ran into a problem where I wanted to have ListView that uses for items an UIElement that contains other elements, but only Text has proper item selection & hover coloring.

Selectable is a class that only implements selection & hover coloring. I refactored Text to inherit from it.

Still missing scripting and editor support.

Also I took the code from my own implementation which uses modern C++, hopefully it isn't a problem.

data.title: Attribute refactoring
data.body:
Fixes #1509
Resolves #1766

data.title: Runaway shadow
data.body:
After just upgrading to version 1.7, from 1.6.1024 (I think) and also changing the renderer from DX9 to DX11, I've got some strange shadow behaviour, where the shadow disappears when the camera is moved at certain angles. I'm not sure if is't a an upgrade issue or DirectX issue as I've changed both at the same time.
![shadow_visible](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/30278394/29565250-8429d31c-8788-11e7-80ae-f50445889244.png)
![shadow_missing](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/30278394/29565252-88666530-8788-11e7-876e-b6b8cb219a65.png)

I just have a single directional light.
Any ideas? A bug or some lighting configuration needs to be changed in the new version?

data.title: Update coding conventions for C++11.
data.body:
Okay, I suppose someone should try to do it at some point. I updated code standard with C++11 items.

They are more advisory than mandatory but I hope they will prevent style mess in the Urho codebase.

I tried to not cutoff useful C++11 features on the one hand, and keep old code more or less consistent with the new one on the other hand.

I understand that some items are potentially disputable, but I really tried to balance opinions mentioned on the Forum. So, this PR is the last chance to discuss freely.

I still heavily rely on the common sence of contributors. At least, let's document the basic guideline for this common sence.

data.title: Fix crash on android
data.body: In some cases old activity may be destroyed after new activity is created. `onCreate()` of new activity gets called and initializes new activity as well as static variables, then `onDestroy()` is called on old activity and cleans up static variables that were just initialized by new activity. This change prevents calling `SDLActivity.initialize()` in `onDestroy()` if new activity has already reinitialized static variables.

data.title: Setting P_ALLOW to "false" on server does not trigger E_SERVERDISCONNECTED
Selectable UI element
data.body:
I ran into a problem where I wanted to have ListView that uses for items an UIElement that contains other elements, but only Text has proper item selection & hover coloring.

Selectable is a class that only implements selection & hover coloring. I refactored Text to inherit from it.

Still missing scripting and editor support.

Also I took the code from my own implementation which uses modern C++, hopefully it isn't a problem.

data.title: Added Clip, Merge, and contructor from pair of IntVector2 to IntRect.
data.body: I added a few utility functions to IntRect for better parity with Rect.

data.title: [iOS] Call to unavailable function system: Not available on iOS
data.body:
Seems that Lua and Urho File Utils (like in FileSystem.cpp) are making calls to the `system()` function, which is deprecated long ago, and is now stripped from iOS.

https://stackoverflow.com/questions/45420717/call-to-unavailable-function-system-not-available-on-ios

This happens with Xcode 9 beta, which will be finalised in a month or so. That will render Urho uncompilable on Xcode 9, which will then render it unable build against iOS 11.

data.title: Shadows do not render on more than one Render Texture using HWDepth
data.body:
Only the last Render Texture to have SetSize() called on it will have correct shadows. The other texture will have no shadows visible  yet if the camera itself is in shadow then the entire scene will be in shadow.

This can be replicated by altering the RenderToTexture sample to have two cameras and two screens. The first render texture will only have shadows if the second render texture is out of view. This bug only occurs when using render paths that make use of HWDepth, like PBRDeferredHWDepth. Notably, the bug does not come up when using ForwardHWDepth.

![rendertexture](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10123724/29492265-6648ee78-852b-11e7-8c0a-c01584ccf89f.PNG)
